FuncDef: To configure the default authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) authentication methods, use the aaa authentication login default command. To revert to the default, use the no form of this command.
CLIs: aaa authentication login default { group <group-list> } [ none ] | local | none }
no aaa authentication login default { group <group-list> } [ none ] | local | none }

ParaDef.Info: Specifies that a server group be used for authentication.

Space-separated list of RADIUS or TACACS+ server groups that can include the following: radius for all configured RADIUS servers. tacacs+ for all configured TACACS+ servers. Any configured RADIUS or TACACS+ server group name.
(Optional) Specifies that the username be used for authentication.
(Optional) Specifies that the local database be used for authentication.

Examples: switch(config)# aaa authentication login default group radius
switch(config)# no aaa authentication login default group radius
ExtraInfo:
The group radius, group tacacs+ , and group group-list methods refer to a set of previously defined RADIUS or TACACS+ servers. Use the radius-server host or tacacs-server host command to configure the host servers. Use the aaa group server command to create a named group of servers.If you specify the group method or local method and they fail, then the authentication fails. If you specify the none method alone or after the group method, then the authentication always succeeds.
Command Default:The local database
msg: Error CLI:aaa authentication login default { group <group-list> } [ none ] | local | none }
Error CLI:no aaa authentication login default { group <group-list> } [ none ] | local | none }
